alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Douglas; Piatt (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 1:53PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Piatt, southwestern Champaign and northwestern Douglas Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 153 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bement, or 11 miles south of Monticello, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Piatt, southwestern Champaign and northwestern Douglas Counties, including the following locations... Ivesdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
